entry.title: Apache Wicket Cookbook Giveaway Contest
entry.content:
Packt Publishing has generously allowed me to give away a free copy of the ebook version of Apache Wicket Cookbook (http://link.packtpub.com/AzN8N9), and a free one year subscription to PacktLib. For details see the contest announcement.

Cheers,
-Igor

entry.title: Wicket 1.5-RC4.2 released
entry.content:
The Wicket Team is proud to introduce the fourth Release Candidate in Wicket 1.5 series. See the changelog for the list of bug fixes and improvements done between 1.5-RC3 and 1.5-RC4.2

More detailed migration notes are available on our Migrate to 1.5 Wiki Page

Release Artifacts:

  • Subversion tag
  • Changelog
  • To use in Maven:
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.apache.wicket</groupId>
    <artifactId>wicket-core</artifactId>
    <version>1.5-RC4.2</version>
</dependency>
  • Download the full distribution (including source)

entry.title: Wicket 1.4.17 released
entry.content:
This is seventeenth release of the Wicket 1.4.x series. This is primarily a minor bugfix release on the 1.4.x (stable) branch.

  • Subversion tag
  • Changelog
  • To use in Maven:
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.apache.wicket</groupId>
    <artifactId>wicket</artifactId>
    <version>1.4.17</version>
</dependency>
  • Download the full distribution (including source)

entry.title: Apache Wicket Cookbook Published!
entry.content:
For the past nine months I have been quietly working on a book about Wicket. Unlike other books on the market this one does not attempt to teach you Wicket from the ground up. Instead, it is for developers who already know the basics and want to learn how to implement some of the more advanced use cases. Essentially, it contains recipes that show the reader how to implement solutions to some of, what I think are, the most commonly asked questions and stumbling blocks.

This morning I was informed that the book has been published! You can read more about it and pick up a copy on PACKT's Site.

I hope you enjoy it, more details are available on Wicket In Action Blog Post

entry.title: Wicket 1.5-rc2 released
entry.content:
The Wicket Team is proud to introduce the second Release Candidate in Wicket 1.5 series. See the changelog for the list of bug fixes and improvements done between 1.5-RC1 and 1.5-rc2

More detailed migration notes are available on our Migrate to 1.5 Wiki Page

entry.title: Wicket 1.5-RC1 released
entry.content:
The Wicket Team is proud to introduce the first Release Candidate in Wicket 1.5 series. The 1.5 series provides the following major improvements:

  • A more powerful and flexible request processing pipeline
  • Intercomponent event mechanism
  • Improved configuration
  • More flexible markup loading
  • Better proxy support (x-forwarded-for header)

More detailed migration notes are available on our Migrate to 1.5 Wiki Page

Release Artifacts:

  • Subversion tag
  • Changelog
  • To use in Maven:
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.apache.wicket</groupId>
    <artifactId>wicket</artifactId>
    <version>1.5-RC1</version>
</dependency>
  • Download the full distribution (including source)
